instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: I got this one whit  <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> fried I take out  and than I feel the   <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> was warm I changed same I found <RESISTOR>R3880</RESISTOR> open I changed warm <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> gone I fire up  but after time the <CHIP>U4100</CHIP> star warm up I try to figure out from where but no luck   any help is  welcome : )

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: Is this board working besides these issues?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: yes it does, i found the <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> go warm too

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: Why bother with this when it is working? Leave <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> off and just live with the fact that the lightning port will never work again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: I install one different <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> i don t find any short,  i can take it out again.   but  still have my <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> warm up i just found my infra temp reader i will post the temp after one min. tomorrow morning  thank for reply bro

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  fire wire  frie : /
threads.message: It is normal for <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> and 3600 to heat up
